timeline.author: macjohnny
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@ sidebar_label: javascript-flowtyped
 | ------ | ----------- | ------ | ------- |
 |allowUnicodeIdentifiers|boolean, toggles whether unicode identifiers are allowed in names or not, default is false| |false|
 |ensureUniqueParams|Whether to ensure parameter names are unique in an operation (rename parameters that are not).| |true|
+|enumPropertyNaming|Naming convention for enum properties: 'camelCase', 'PascalCase', 'snake_case', 'UPPERCASE', and 'original'| |PascalCase|

replies.bodyText:
I was surprised also.
But apparently,
class JavascriptFlowtypedClientCodegen extends AbstractTypeScriptClientCodegen
replies.author: amakhrov

timeline.bodyText: maybe the available values in ENUM_PROPERTY_NAMING_TYPE could be listed automatically, so the comment will not be outdated
timeline.author: macjohnny

timeline.bodyText: maybe you would want to add a test for the non-original case, too?
timeline.author: macjohnny

timeline.message: Add enumPropertyNaming option to typescript generators
Use actual enum values in an error message, instead of hardcoding them
Add tests for "UPPERCASE" and "snake_case" enum var namings
Add tests for "UPPERCASE" and "snake_case" enum var namings
